snippet: An agreement for Cyprus to tax individual bank accounts as part of a 15.8 billion euro bailout has raised fears of bank runs in other nations that use the euro.
abstract: Stocks decline as investors worry that proposal to seize money from bank depositors in Cyprus could cause more anxiety over fate of euro.
lead_paragraph: An agreement for Cyprus to tax individual bank accounts as part of a 15.8 billion euro bailout has raised fears of bank runs in other nations that use the euro.

headline.seo: Market Falls on Fear Cyprus Deal Could Hurt Euro
headline.main: Market Declines on Fear Cyprus Deal Could Hurt Euro
headline.print_headline: Market Declines on Fear Cyprus Deal Could Hurt Euro
